More keys needed to unlock message.

ArcanaCards are minted in groups called 'Topics'. There are two types of cards: message cards and key cards. To reveal a hidden message you need the message card and atleast two of the key cards (exactly how many will depend on the 'locks' setting when the topic was minted). ArcanaCard groups cards together when you scan them and shows you how many more you might need before you can reveal the hidden message.
 
On the main screen the topics are listed, each with a set of letter indicators at the top right. The indicators are:
 
* M nnnK nnnL nnnT
 
'*' Means you can read the hidden message because you have the message card and enough of the keys to unlock it (short-press on the topic to read the message),
 
'M' Means you have scanned the message code (but you may not be able to read it if you don't have enough keys),
 
nnnK How many keys you have for this topic (nnn is shorthand for the number of keys you've collected),
 
nnnL How many locks are on the message. To unlock a hidden message you need the message and this many keys (nnn is the number locks on the message),
 
nnnT The total number of keys that were made for this message.
 
You can long-press on a topic to access other topic-related options, but to get started press the NEW button to create your first topic.

'Keys' are the number of codes that will be created.
 
'Locks' are the number of keys that must be scanned to reveal your hidden message.
 
'Clues' can be attached to keys and can be read as soon as a key is scanned.
 
Choose clues that create an interesting game mechanic, ie. the locations of other keys or portions of a text. Use the menu autofill options to get started with some quote-based games from some public domain texts.

Great work, you\' made a new topic. You can test out your new topic with a long-press and selecting \'View QRCodes\' (if you have a friend with ArcanaCard they can try scanning the codes) or you can select \'Export for printing\'.\n \nExporting your topic to a PC and printing the codes is the way to take ArcanaCard out into the real world.
This version of ArcanaCard is restricted to 7 keys, 7 locks and 63 character messages and clues.

This application implements a version of Shamir's Secret Sharing Algorithm with 56 bit polynomial coefficients to reveal a 56 bit rc4 cipher key to decrypt the hidden message. Topic tokens are signed with a per-topic single-use 96 bit authentication key. Arithmetic for the polynomial evaluation and for the authentication signature are performed on the non-prime binary-field GF(2^112), a Koblitz curve.
